      • isEventPublishingEnabled

        public boolean isEventPublishingEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: EventPublisher
        Returns whether events will be published by the event bus or not.
        Specified by:
        isEventPublishingEnabled in interface EventPublisher
        Returns:
        true if event publishing is enabled; false otherwise.

      • setEventPublishingEnabled

        public void setEventPublishingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: EventPublisher
        Sets the enabled state for event publishing.

        Events will be automatically discarded when the enabled state is set to false.
        Specified by:
        setEventPublishingEnabled in interface EventPublisher
        Parameters:
        enabled - the value fot the enabled state.

                                  Event event)
        Description copied from interface: EventPublisher

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        event - the event to be published

      • removeEventListener

        public void removeEventListener(@Nonnull
                                Map<String,Object> listener)
        Description copied from interface: EventPublisher
        Removes a Map containing event listeners.

        An event listener may be

        • a RunnableWithArgs
        • a CallableWithArgs

        Maps require handlers to be named as eventName only.

        Some examples of eventHandler names are: StartupStart, MyCoolEvent. Event names must follow the camelCase naming convention.

        Specified by:
        removeEventListener in interface EventPublisher
        Parameters:
        listener - an event listener of type Map
